title-group.article-title: High Order Fast Laplace Solvers for the Dirichlet Problem on General Regions

abstract.p: Highly accurate finite difference schemes are developed for Laplace's equation with the Dirichlet boundary condition on general bounded regions in $R^n$. A second order accurate scheme is combined with a deferred correction or Richardson extrapolation method to increase the accuracy. The Dirichlet condition is approximated by a method suggested by Heinz-Otto Kreiss. A convergence proof of his, previously not published, is given which shows that, for the interval size $h$, one of the methods has an accuracy of at least $O(h^{5.5})$ in $L_2$. The linear systems of algebraic equations are solved by a capacitance matrix method. The results of our numerical experiments show that highly accurate solutions are obtained with only a slight additional use of computer time when compared to the results obtained by second order accurate methods.
